page.title: 01South Truro and Hinterland
page.content: The landscape consists of urban development in the north with the remainder of the area being rural. The buildings are developed in a linear fashion along the A 39 to the West. To the East the Port has declined. Lemon Quay is a Car Park and Urban redevelopment is proposed for Newham with the chance of a small boat marina. The rural hinterland is relatively sparse in population with a few hamlets and farms providing commuting or rural work opportunities. The dairy/mixed farm economy makes this both a productive and attractive landscape with the estuarine scenery contrasting with urban areas to the North and industrial dereliction to the West. These soft contours are typical of mid-Southern Cornwall and continue North-East through the Roseland Peninsula.
